embeds.title: High Noon
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 (1) :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you play a Strike or Defend, draw a card.

messages.content: Oh boy, hermit basic package discussion part 2.
okay so while the last card was terrible this one is either absolutely degenerate or literally nothing
I hate how reserves relies on this card, so, so hard.
Unlike yesterday's card, <short fuse>, this card actually serves a purpose.

embeds.title: Short Fuse
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 3 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 18 (22) damage.
Costs 1 less :energy_hermit:  per Strike or Defend played this turn.

messages.content: if you don't have high noon, you can't do a reserves focused run at all
and while you only need one copy to be degenerate with it, you honestly want two so you can power past nemesis' burns, because reserves decks are incredibly small.
off topic question: where does the term "reserves" come from?
reserves is the name of the upgrade from star of providence that makes your basic weapon better but doesn't improve non basic weapons
and since hermit is that game I've basically reused the term
makes sense because the cards that scale strikes don't scale any of the other cards
namely maintenance and high noon
Ah, makes sense. I just don't know that game.
you should try it, its good and I think there's a demo somewhere?
either way I feel like the archetype SHOULD be haha funny I made strike bludgeon and defend impervious
but
its not
looks interesting, might get it if it's ever on sale
the archetype revolves around an incredibly mind melting infinite and requires a rare card, more or less
either you have take cover x2, or eternal form
yeah 2x <take cover> and this is infinite

embeds.title: Take Cover
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / X :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Add a 0-cost Defend (+) to your hand and **Upgrade** it X times.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: honestly I don't think high noon is a well balanced card, any power that has infinite draw in a turn can and will be used for infinites
the 'balance' is that its rare and without it the archetype literally doesn't exist
Which makes it even worse design to me.

I feel like there are so many ways that reserves could be made better but the issue is that half the cards meant to interact with it either don't or suck, and you literally need high noon to win act 3 because even if you have 17 damage strikes its not even close enough to winning
like, 1 for 17 is terrible by act 3 standards
but 0 for 8 block and 1 draw?
lol
and the showdown reversion to not exhaust and cost 1 is a good step, I guess
Yeah it lacks any utility too, I think that's a big issue too.

ultimately I think an interesting power idea to make strike/defends have actual synergy outside of the... 2-3 cards they work with, maybe a power that makes cards that activate dead-on also count as strikes/defends?
The main issue with strike/defend is that adding more cards to your deck makes it worse, but you need to add cards to survive. It just feels very backwards.
In late game, almost all non strike/defend/synergy cards are dead draws in that type of deck
there are few safe cards but it’s p much just energy and draw stuff

okay every reserves card: body armor (uses dexterity from maintenance twice, good), high caliber (2 energy strike, bad unless you've lost a strike from falling event, okay enough act 1 damage card), cheat (maintenance, good), fully loaded (good outside of the archetype, superflous inside), lone wolf (poor mans cheat), maintenance (obligatory card), short fuse (LOL), showdown (infinite if you have sundial, superflous if you have eternal form), take cover (worse reinforced body unless you have high noon and then becomes best card), high noon (obligatory card), eternal form (obligatory if you don't have x2 take cover)
and then misc. stuff like flash powder.
and spite for statuses.

there should be a short fuse rework, a high caliber cost reduction (the strike still costs 1 but you don't need to spend 2 energy on getting and playing it), and another rare that makes strikes better
i suppose also adapt
same reason as spite but also exhaust your dead draws
adapt is probably misc. card
plus you can thin your deck for infinites easier ig
hmm idk if high caliber cost reduc would work that well
bc it’s prob too strong at something like 1 cost 12 early
maybe just make it 1(0)?
<high-caliber>

embeds.title: High-Caliber
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 6 (9) damage.
Add a Strike+2 (3)　 to your hand.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: my issue with high caliber is that it effectively costs 2
yeah but the problem is without costing 2 it has no actual way to justify itself as an early damage card tbh
so within the archetype itself, ignoring falling, and ignoring act 1 damage cards, this will always be worse than playing maintenance
and then playing a strike
thus making your early game even worse
because it makes every strike better instead of making one better strike
since strike decks tend to die early a lot if you don’t take dead draws

so the only reason you would have this in a late game reserves deck is if you got falling and had to remove a strike because the skill was maintenance or take cover, and the power was high noon, eternal form, or power overwhelming
Hello would you like to turn <type=card add a defend to your hand> into <finesse> lol

embeds.title: Finesse
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / Slay the Spire

Gain 2 (4) **Block** :p_block:.
Draw 1 card.

messages.content: I mean its a janky infinite enabler, i guess thats something, although if you want to achieve victory via this method you need two copies to make it deal damage 💀
In terms of actual value i mean you arnt really winning a basic card run without it, its about as much of a crutch for this archetype as <exotic form> is for unidentified spam

embeds.title: Exotic Form
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

​~~- **Snekproof.** -~~
Whenever you play an **Offclass** card, draw 1 card.

messages.content: And i think the reason for this is the entire basic card archetype as a whole being underpowered, not that this should get bumped to uncommon (I.E defect solution)
who wants to infinite?
also this card used to be 2(1)
I was about to object, then I realized Reckless Charge Infinite exists
what is this anyway, reckless charge + evolve + some exhaust skill + uhhh pommel strike? + sundial?
reckless charge evolve+ medkit dark embrace
the dazed ends up essentially becoming a master of strategy but the draw is in 2 different instances
ah, medkit
yeah makes sense

You have fully loaded, maintenance, short fuse, showdown, strike dummy, and this supporting your strikes/defends. Take cover and high caliber can help you put better strikes/defends into your deck. In my opinion, that just isn’t enough quality to prevent me from removing strikes/defends when I get the opportunity. These support cards make them less bad, not actively good. High noon is perhaps the most tempting of them all, drawing a card is a really nice benefit, and can lead to infinites with a thin deck and adapt/malice. 

However, it’s far weaker than it looks, you still have to pay the 1 energy to get a weak effect from strike/defend, on top of the 1 energy to put an Unupgraded copy of high noon into play before drawing any cards, which is very slow and expensive. This can get interesting if you have snecko eye, or you find ancient writing in act 2, or if shining light/war paint/wetstone upgrade some strikes and defends. Unfortunately, the most common ways to get rares are from the act 1 and 2 boss card rewards, which happen before seeing the boss relic, so it’s hard to get in a situation where you feel confident adding this. I would not advise leaning into this synergy package at high ascension, it’s mostly a meme in my experience. A bit more viable if it’s pre-upgraded from frozen egg, or to enable some extra cheap card draw alongside eternal form. Definitely fun to try out at lower ascensions though, and I do like the idea of attempting to makes strikes/defends better as part of hermits kit. It's really the rest of the support that falls a little short, high noon itself is pretty good. It can feel like a bit of a trap, promising the potential of a way to makes strikes/defends powerful and part of a lategame engine alongside maintenance, but getting that to come together is very unwieldy.

absolutely true! High noon is useless in most runs you play; its only usable if the stars aline and you can some how set up a strike and defend deck (which involves finding this and a lot of other cards all at once early in the game; very unlikely).
I really hate high noon, it feels like All for one, but if it only worked for claws. Its dead almost every time I see it and it only exists to prop up a a meme strategy.
I'd say it's all for one if it only worked on zap+ and dualcast+.
